## Our Voices

What does our group look like? Let's see the breakdown. @cr-gender

**68 women (45.3%)** form the largest group. @cr-gender

**62 men (41.3%)** are close behind. @cr-gender

And **20 non-binary people (13.3%)** enrich our perspectives. A group is only as strong as its diversity of thought. @cr-gender

:::{#cr-gender}
```{python}
#| echo: false
fig = go.Figure()

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(
    y=gender_df["Gender"],
    x=gender_df["Count"],
    orientation="h",
    marker=dict(
        color=gender_df["Color"],
        cornerradius=8,
    ),
    text=[f"  {c}  ({p}%)" for c, p in zip(gender_df["Count"], gender_df["Pct"])],
    textposition="outside",
    textfont=dict(size=16, family="Space Grotesk", color="#e2e8f0"),
    hovertemplate="%{y}: %{x} people<extra></extra>",
))

fig.update_layout(
    **dark_template,
    title="Gender Composition",
    xaxis=dict(title="Number of People", gridcolor="rgba(148,163,184,0.1)",
               range=[0, 85]),
    yaxis=dict(title="", autorange="reversed"),
    height=380,
    showlegend=False,
)
fig.show()
```

## What Fuels Us?

Time for the important stuff: **what do we drink every week?** @cr-drinks

**2,100 liters of water** ‚Äî enough to fill **10 bathtubs** every single week! @cr-drinks

**525 liters of coffee** could fill a small hot tub. That's 3.5 liters per person ‚Äî roughly **5 cups a day**. @cr-drinks

**300L of tea**, **150L of soda**, **120L of juice**, and **45L of energy drinks** complete the menu. @cr-drinks

:::{focus-on="cr-drinks"}
::: {.fun-fact}
**Fun fact:** If we lined up all our weekly water bottles (500ml each), they'd stretch for 2.1 km ‚Äî the length of 20 football fields!
:::
:::

## How Do We Move?

Every week our group covers **15,000 km** combined ‚Äî more than a third of the way around the Earth! @cr-transport

**Cars** still lead at **6,750 km/week** (45%). The biggest slice of our carbon footprint. @cr-transport

**Buses & transit** at **4,500 km** (30%) ‚Äî public transport for the win! @cr-transport

The green heroes: **2,250 km walked** and **1,500 km biked** every week ‚Äî 25 km of zero-emission travel per person. @cr-transport

:::{focus-on="cr-transport"}
::: {.fun-fact}
**Challenge:** If every car trip under 5 km switched to biking, we'd save roughly **820 kg of CO‚ÇÇ per week** as a group!
:::
:::

:::{#cr-transport}

## Three Words About the SDGs

We asked: **"Name three words that come to mind when you think about the SDGs."** @cr-words

The biggest words reflect our collective consciousness: **Future**, **Hope**, and **Action** dominated. @cr-words

**Together**, **Planet**, and **Change** tell us something powerful ‚Äî we see the SDGs as a shared journey toward transformation. @cr-words

**Innovation** and **Community** sit side by side ‚Äî we believe solutions come from working collectively with creative minds. @cr-words

:::{#cr-words}
```{python}
#| echo: false
import math

colors = ["#38bdf8","#f472b6","#a78bfa","#34d399","#fbbf24","#818cf8",
          "#22d3ee","#fb923c","#86efac","#f472b6","#38bdf8","#fbbf24",
          "#a78bfa","#34d399","#818cf8","#22d3ee","#f87171","#c084fc",
          "#86efac","#fb923c","#67e8f9","#fbbf24","#f472b6","#38bdf8",
          "#34d399","#a78bfa","#818cf8","#fbbf24","#22d3ee","#f87171"]

n = len(words_df)
# Place words on a spiral
fig = go.Figure()

x_coords = []
y_coords = []
for i in range(n):
    angle = i * 0.75
    radius = 0.5 + i * 0.35
    x_coords.append(radius * math.cos(angle))
    y_coords.append(radius * math.sin(angle) * 0.7)

max_mentions = words_df["Mentions"].max()
min_mentions = words_df["Mentions"].min()

for i, row in words_df.iterrows():
    # Scale font size between 12 and 42 based on mentions
    frac = (row["Mentions"] - min_mentions) / (max_mentions - min_mentions)
    font_size = 12 + frac * 30

    fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(
        x=[x_coords[i]],
        y=[y_coords[i]],
        mode="text",
        text=[row["Word"]],
        textfont=dict(
            size=font_size,
            color=colors[i % len(colors)],
            family="Space Grotesk, sans-serif"
        ),
        hovertemplate=f"{row['Word']}: {row['Mentions']} mentions<extra></extra>",
        showlegend=False,
    ))

fig.update_layout(
    **dark_template,
    title="What We Think About ‚Äî Words Sized by Frequency",
    xaxis=dict(visible=False),
    yaxis=dict(visible=False, scaleanchor="x"),
    height=520,
)
fig.show()
```
:::

**Geothermal (18)** ‚Äî calm on the surface, full of fire underneath. **Biomass (14)** ‚Äî literally fueled by leftovers. @cr-energy

## Spirit Animal in Meetings

**"What's your spirit animal in team meetings?"** @cr-animals

**Sloth (35)** takes the crown. Slow, steady, and occasionally asleep with eyes open. @cr-animals

**Owl (32)** ‚Äî the wise observers. **Golden Retriever (28)** ‚Äî just SO HAPPY to be here. @cr-animals

**Cat (25)** ‚Äî shows up, judges everyone, leaves. **Parrot (18)** ‚Äî repeats everything the manager says. **Penguin (12)** ‚Äî looks formal, slides around on their belly. @cr-animals

:::{.cr-section layout="sidebar-left"}

## The Great Plant Census

The question that haunts us all: **"How many houseplants have you accidentally... composted?"** @cr-plants

Only **22 people (15%)** claim zero casualties. We salute you, Plant Whisperers. @cr-plants

**45 people** lost **1-3 plants** ‚Äî the biggest group. Everyone gets a learning curve. @cr-plants

**38** admitted to 4-7 casualties, **25 brave souls** confessed to 8+, and **20** simply said "Lost count." Combined estimated casualties: **487 plants**. Moment of silence. @cr-plants

:::{#cr-plants}
```{python}
#| echo: false
fig = go.Figure()

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(
    y=plant_df["Range"],
    x=plant_df["Count"],
    orientation="h",
    marker=dict(color=plant_df["Color"], cornerradius=8),
    text=[f"  {i} {c}" for i, c in zip(plant_df["Icon"], plant_df["Count"])],
    textposition="outside",
    textfont=dict(size=15, family="Space Grotesk", color="#e2e8f0"),
    hovertemplate="%{y}: %{x} people<extra></extra>",
))

fig.update_layout(
    **dark_template,
    title="Houseplant Casualties",
    xaxis=dict(title="People", gridcolor="rgba(148,163,184,0.1)", range=[0, 58]),
    yaxis=dict(title="", autorange="reversed"),
    height=400,
    showlegend=False,
    annotations=[dict(
        text="Combined casualties: ~487 plants ü™¶",
        xref="paper", yref="paper", x=0.5, y=-0.1,
        showarrow=False, font=dict(size=12, color="#64748b")
    )]
)
fig.show()
```
